review_text:
A wonderful stay on a very unique property. This is indeed a very "cozy" location, but also quite spacious for what it is. It's built higher off the ground, which lends to the treehouse feel (although it's not the same type of "treehouse" you may have had as a kid!).
Very clean, comfortable, and quiet. Tons of natural light through large windows, which we loved. There is lots of outdoor seating, with several porch areas. This place was exactly what we were hoping for, and we were very pleased. Just be sure to read the description and instructions carefully. We were fine without a full kitchen, and came prepared accordingly.
We recommend this place highly. It was a peaceful, private stay in a uniquely imagined space. Host was excellent and very responsive to our needs. Thank you!

The treehouse itself had some of neatest features, but the hammock on the second floor had to be our favorite. The decor, ambiance and natural lighting made you feel like you were lost in the mountains, but in reality you're just 10 minutes from everything in Downtown Greenville. We didn't spend much time on the top balcony, at the fire pit, or on the back porch, simply because we went in May amongst an abundance of mosquitos and spiders. There was some work being done on the property (tree cutting), but Kaye and Ben were extremely communicative and apologetic that it coincided with our stay. Overall, highly recommend the Cozy Treehouse for a one-of-a-kind trip!

I read reviews about the noise from the Orangetheory downstairs but we didnâ€™t hear it at all. The apartment had eye masks and ear plugs in cute decorative pouches just in case. The eye masks did come in handy because there are not black out curtains so it gets really bright in there in the morning!
Keurig machine with coffee options (including sweeteners) were there waiting for us in the very well stocked kitchen .
Thank you for an amazing stay at an affordable price for this single mama with two teenage boys who were also very impressed (and thatâ€™s hard to do)!

Our heat wasnâ€™t working the night we moved in and Mint House was extremely responsive and helped us to remedy the issue while we were at work. By the time we made it home that evening after 10pm they had made arrangements for us to move to another unit and the apartment was already pre heated. Our transfer to another unit across the hall was seamless and we went to bed nice and cozy. They even responded to us that evening to make sure we were all set. Thank you Mint House for a lovely stay. I would definitely recommend to anyone and come back and stay again when visiting South Carolina.

We've stayed here two years in a row for a conference. Great location - right near coffee and restaurants and the river walking path. The place itself is solid - nothing fancy and no character to speak of (very bland and utilitarian), but just what you need for a conference. Beds very comfortable.
We had a few issues with checkin which i think reflected confusion between Mint House and Airbnb, and also the lift was broken for a full morning at least (for a 5th floor flat) which made coming and going that day extremely awkward (lots of stairs). Fortunately it was fixed in time for us getting to the airport with loads of suitcases.
Overall i'd say a good place with a few issues which aren't insurmountable, but good to be aware of if you book.

review_text:
This unit is located in a building that appeared to be all rental units. The location is spot on, we could walk just across the street and down a set of stairs to the river. Two lefts leads you to downtown and all the shopping and eating you want to do. on the way to downtown try Bubble Tea (that tiger sugar boba tea was amazing!)
The rooms and layout were exactly as described, but the pictures of the furniture are not accurate. The headboards, sofa, rugs, chairs, trees/greenery are all different then pictured.
The bedding was amazing, very soft and clean (mattresses were wrapped in plastic covers [didn't make any noise though]) Each bed had at least six pillows on it.
Kitchen had wine glasses, regular glasses, plates, pans, pots, and utensils.
Elevator was very efficient and there was a luggage cart in the lobby area.
I would stay there again.

review_text:
Great location for visiting Greenville, everything is in walking distance and the quick access to the park is nice. The apartment had a lot of room. The furniture was different than the picture but it was fine. The pictures are accurate. I was a little surprised about the build quality of the apartment for such a new building but the pictures reflect this. The place could use some better design elements but not really important for our stay. The coffee supplies are a nice touch.
PARKING TIP: Parking in front of the building is not allowed. there is a big underground lot across the street. To enter, drive across to the Hampton Inn front door and pass the valet stand. Immediately to your right is a down ramp into the parking garage. It is easy to miss. You can use Parkmobile to pay (or credit card) and it is not very expensive. It would be helpful if the Mint House team would include this in their welcome email since the entrance to the paring garage is not easy to find.

This was my 2nd stay at a Mint House apartment. It was very clean and the apartment was as expected. The location is great for access to downtown Greenville. We parked the car when we arrived and didnâ€™t use it again until we left! I will definitely stay there again on my next trip to Greenville.
Our only complaint was access to the fitness center. In our arrival instructions it said â€œ24 hour fitness centerâ€ that was open from 10-5, but if you wanted to access it outside that time to let the management know and they would make arrangements. I emailed the day before our arrival to ask about getting access outside that window (10 seems very late to me as I am a morning exerciser) and never received a response. Then I asked when we arrived at the property and was told that the keypad entry was broken (and he made it sound like it had been for awhile) and there was no way for us to get in until someone from the management company arrived, generally between 9-10 am.

review_text: We were visiting the area for the weekend and two out of our four days it poured rain. We were thrilled to have this extra roomy space and felt at home. The kitchen had everything you need to make a meal but the place is just a block away from an array of restaurants (and shopping). The space was clean and roomy. We had overlooked the note from the host that there was quiet time at 9pm on and the room had a sound decibel machine inside. Despite our concerns after reading this, we did not have any issues and did not hear any other guests in the building. We actually rarely saw anyone. The only down side, if it is one, is there is not onsite parking. This wasn't a problem as there is a parking garage across the street and the majority of our trip we walked to where we needed to go. The convenient location, spacious place, and accommodations were great! I'd definitely stay here again.

review_text: The Mint House apartment we stayed in was clean, spacious and the beds bathrooms were really nice! It was in a great location, close to downtown and the river, and had a nice kitchen and washer and dryer too! We only stayed for one night so it was perfect for what we needed. I saw comments about it being bright, and these were definitely true. It wasnâ€™t just bright in the morning but also bright at night. There are huge windows with thin blinds and the street lights and big blue light from the front entrance all shine in. That being said, they do at least provide 2 little eye covers to wear while you sleep if you like to use those. My only other improvement Iâ€™d make is more living room seating. The beds would sleep 6 comfortably but you could really only seat 3-4 on the small couch and chair in the living room. Overall it was a great stay for what we needed!

review_text:
We were two couples who stayed at this classic urban condo during Euphoria Festival weekend. The location was excellent and easy walking distance to all the events.
The condo is stylishly furnished and inviting.
We gave a four star rating instead of five for the following reasons:
the restaurant and bar below had noise and music all three nights until midnight. We were aware of this issue through the listing write up and reviews for the property but were left with the impression that the noise ended at 10 pm. The owners do provide ear plugs and sound machine which helps but does not eliminate the sound transfer all together.
The king beds are comfortable but the bottom sheets need deeper pockets as they keep coming off and we ended up sleeping on the mattress protector.
We left a note for the cleaning people
with a small list of other things that we felt you needed to be aware of.
Overall we were impressed with the condition of the unit and would recommend it.

Next time I come to town with my husband heâ€™s going to want to stay at the new Grand Bohemian, but itâ€™s going to be a fight because I would love to come back to this apartment (which is just a lovely walk from the GB to go enjoy the restaurant and bar). John was a very friendly and responsive host. Highly recommend! Would note that there is a busy and loud restaurant below, but there were white noise machines in the bedrooms so that even my light-sleeper travel companion was able to sleep through it.

The bathrooms in the bedrooms had barn sliding doors that didn't close in a way that there was any privacy. I realize that we were located on Main Street and one must allow for noise at night, but the bar beneath us had no insulation from the sound below. We could hear distinct conversations like we were sitting in the bar. This is something to bear in mind when booking this property. Our group had 2 couples. We drove together and that was a good thing, because there was only one parking pass. If we drove separately, as we originally planned, one of us would have had to pay for parking. I think that is bad form, considering what we paid for the weekend.

name: Kristyn
rating_info:
Rating, 3 stars
,
Â·
November 2022
,
Â·
Stayed about a week
review_text: We booked this apartment for a 9 night stay. We arrived a few minutes after 3p which was the designated check in time. The cleaning person was still cleaning stating they were running behind and would need another 20 minutes. She allowed us to bring in the few bags of groceries we had as well as our luggage. It ended up taking her almost 45 minutes to finish up. Not a big deal but we were ready to relax after a 11 hour drive that started at 4a. The apartment was much larger than expected and decorated very nicely. Bedrooms and bathrooms were large. Kitchen was well appointed. We made breakfast in the apartment most mornings but there were enough pots, pans, etc to cook a full meal if wanted. The vibe of the apartment as well as the whole floor was super cool. My husband and I were both very pleased with the apartment. Loved the exposed bricks, wood floor and beams, as well as the huge windows in our unit. The unit has 3 TVs but no cable or satellite so you watch tv via apps. Took us awhile to get used to that but once we did it was ok. The location was good as well although admittedly we always found ourselves heading north when leaving thru the door on Main Street. We did head south a few times but most of what you will walk to is north and a reasonable walk. As I said both my husband and I were very pleased with the apartment. Free parking was a huge bonus too. The downside to the apartment is the excessive noise from the restaurant, Coral, below. Coral is a restaurant with a popular bar, which sits directly below this apartment. They donâ€™t start playing music until mid afternoon. They donâ€™t stop playing music until 11p or a few nights closer to midnight. The building being old without any sound proofing and the location of this apartment being right over the bar is not a good combo. You not only hear the very loud music, but you can also hear peoples conversations - not muffled, full conversations. Again that stops by midnight so if you arenâ€™t wanting to be asleep before then probably not a problem for you. We got used to it but both of us were very frustrated the first couple of nights. The thing we could not get past is the cleaning people showing up at 5am to clean the restaurant - with a shop vac. It woke us up every single morning with the exception of Monday and Tuesday since they were closed on Sunday and Monday. Our first night we sat in the bar at Coral and ordered dinner. My husband was talking to who he thought was one of the employees about the noise level. Turns out it was one of the owners. They were very nice and comped our dinner because of the noise level. They also said that they know that there are frequent noise complaints from the renters staying in the apartments above but that they follow the city ordinance. Regardless of how nice the apartments are the noise from Coral below is just too much for us to return or recommend to anyone else. Itâ€™s a shame because the apartment really is terrific. There are 3 other apartments on the same floor so apartment #4 (which would be over the back of the restaurant) may be quieter.

review_text: Our stay here was wonderful! Everything was nice & clean, and anything that we could have needed for our stay was provided. The bed & the pillows we're comfortable. The Wi-Fi worked great, and the Roku TV had all the Streaming services we'd typically use. The Coffee maker was nice, as well as all of the other appliances, gadgets & furniture. The room is well lit, inside & outside, even the stairs! Plus shades when you need them. There was anything you could need to accommodate your stay, and more. The AC/Heater worked wonderfully, we were were never too hot or too cold. The shower was awesome as well, and we never ran out of hot water. Plus all of the Towels were nice. Everything was clean, the linens, towels, & the room itself smelled great. I have to say that the rugs were incredibly soft & plush, a minor detail but we absolutely loved them. Overall the studio was incredibly tidy, neat & clean. We truly enjoyed our stay here and would love to stay again in the future!

We enjoyed our stay. The hosts were very responsive.
Because I had looked for this information in the reviews and didn't see anyone mention it:
1) as you would expect of a historic cabin, there was a very slight musty smell. It went away as we got used to it during our stay, and it wasn't a reason for me to not book again. Just something I had wondered about before our stay and thought I would include for others wondering
2) the property is next to a busy highway. It got quieter in the late evening, but there's definitely traffic next to the property. You are still in a city, despite the rustic setting. Since we normally live in a rural area, I brought a fan for white noise, and that was all I needed to get a good night's sleep.

review_text: We wanted to go to Greenville but not pay the high hotel prices. There were many other Air B&Bs listed but none were as reasonably priced, and we didn't need much space. We loved everything being in one room (except for the kitchen and bathroom!) The floor in the bathroom sloped a bit, but given that the cabin was built in the 1800s we considered it "character"! I also loved the minimum check out requirements -- basically just run the dishwasher before leaving, and leaving used towels in a hamper. Usually we have to empty garbage and sometimes even strip the sheets. They really took care of everything else! We also loved the privacy and coziness. If we visit Greenville again we will definitely stay there!

review_text:
It's immediately clear that this is an old place, but it is very well kept and super charming and comfortable! There is plenty of outdoor seating and scenery, though the one night my bf and I stayed, we stayed hidden away in the cozy and comfortable cottage. Though the bathroom was small, it was done up very nicely and had plenty of fresh towels available. The little kitchen also had everything, including a dishwasher, stove and wall oven. I don't remember if the bnb is pet friendly but we thought it was very cool that there was a big doggy door on the door leading to the side yard with the outdoor seating. The bed was super comfortable and had luxurious bedding. Also was delighted to see a functioning fireplace with wood handy!
As a local, it was a perfect couples retreat, a nice place to escape within the city. Will definitely return and 100% recommend. Nat 20s for hospitality! Thank you Tony and Racquel!

We had a lovely time exploring Greenville & Erinâ€™s place (top floor unit) was a great home base for a few days!
We appreciated the central location and personal touch of some sweet Christmas decorations; nice Roku TV and the electric fireplace was cozy.
Plenty of closet space with hangers & a nice chest of drawers in the br.
Updated, functional and full kitchen & coffee setup (Nespresso & old-school pot).
Solid shower setup with stationary shampoo, conditioner, body wash & black washcloths for makeup.
Amazing hot water & shower-head pressure and lots of towels!
Considerations: As other reviewers have noted, there are sirens in the area so use a white noise app/machine or bring a fan to help sleep. The bed is pretty firm, so if you prefer a softer mattress, just a consideration :)
All in all, good spot!

review_text: The unit was exactly as pictured and well cleaned, although the carpet has significant stains and probably should be replaced. Access to the unit was easy and Amy was very responsive any time I had a question. On site parking was easily accessed through the alley and felt very secure. In our opinion, access to downtown is not convenient. The fastest route to Main Street takes about 15 minutes but forces you to use the narrow sidewalk directly next to a very busy three lane road. Selecting the â€œneighborhood routeâ€ to the Riverwalk is quieter and more pleasant than but takes about 30 minutes. If you plan on spending significant time downtown, this may not be the best location if you prefer to walk. The unit also backs up to that same busy three lane road (the feeder ramp to I385) making it very noisy for sleeping. With the bedroom on the back of the house, traffic noise is pretty much constant all night long.

The unit has alot of natural light which makes it cheery but could use some room-darkening shades in the bedroom which overlooks a busy highway. Fairly clean although the carpeting is old and stained in places. Spacious bathroom with good water pressure although I was freaked out when I found a huge palmetto bug one morning. The hosts said they had never seen one there, and they used preventive measures. Iâ€™m not from SC, but was told a rain event which we had the night before may have triggered it. Upon arrival there was no guidebook with recommendations but upon request the host put one together. Overall, an ok stay for a good price.

name: Laurie
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
Â·
March 2024
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: This Airbnb unit (Unit 1) has large, spacious rooms in a nicely renovated historic house. The listing pictures are accurate. There is more than one unit in this structure. There are 2 things to note if both bedrooms are used: 1) one of the full baths is right off the kitchen downstairs and 2) the back bedroom is a half-flight down from the upstairs full bathroom which may prove a little tricky during nocturnal trips! The listing does describe this somewhat. The neighborhood is quiet except for the street noise coming from I-385 which is a block behind the house. Cleveland Park with an entrance to the Swamp Rabbit Trail is 4 blocks away. Downtown is about a 15-minute easy walk. Parking in the private lot behind the house is good. Turning left off I-385 into the neighborhood took some time during rush hour(s) so it's good to plan for alternate routes. Entry and check-out instructions were easy. Erin was responsive during the stay. Note: early check-in may be available for a fee.

We had a great weekend at Adam and Abby's place!
There was plenty of space for our family of four to relax together or apart when we weren't walking to the park & zoo or restaurants & sites downtown.
The bathrooms both have bath/showers so there wasn't a line to get ready in the morning or for getting ready to go out for the evening.
Plus, there was a full kitchen with separate dining space for the mornings, which came in handy for our impromptu leftover magic breakfast with fresh eggs and leftovers from Fork and Plough.
Of course, we can't forget to mention the Nespresso coffee machine, which definitely got some use since the closest coffee shops appeared to closed on the weekends.
Thanks for having us, Adam and Abby!

,
Â·
Stayed one night
review_text:
From the get go Jimmy was very proactive and friendly! Gave us great recommendations for local events and places to eat. Our apartment unit was on the 2nd floor-- I didn't realize that I probably overlooked that on app), but it was not an issue.
I loved and appreciated the fact that there is art on the walls to purchase! What a phenomenal place to showcase!! I also really appreciated that Jimmy included local menus and guidebooks for the area.
The apartment is adorable. There was some traffic noise, as this location is right on a Main street, however with the AC and ceiling fan on we only heard the occasional ambulance. Being near a hospital that is to be expected.
The double sided brick fireplace and gorgeous wooden mantle is a sweet call back to yesteryear.
This unit is minutes from the cute Zoo. We ordered in from Willy Tacos. Enjoyed a wonderful lunch at The Bohemian Cafe.
Thank you Jimmy for the wonderful host that you are. Hope to be back in Greenville soon!

name: Garrett

Rating, 4 stars

,
Â·
Stayed with a pet
review_text:
We had a mostly nice stay at this Airbnb while visiting Greenville for a week. The location is extremely convenient for visiting downtown. The air conditioner ran very cold during our heat wave week with temperatures over 95Â° which was needed. The entryway to the house was nice with lots of character.
Some downsides - being a pretty small place thereâ€™s no place to sit besides the bed or one chair, or at the kitchen table. Sometimes the Wi-Fi was a little choppy which was a problem for working remotely. The chairs on the front porch were majorly in need of fresh paint. But probably the main creepy downside was the appearance of four huge cockroaches scurrying over the walls and floor two nights while we were lying in bed watching TV. These things took multiple shoe smacks to take down. I killed three back to back one evening and flushed them in the toilet in the morning and was very amazed to find them still alive, their little legs squirming as they traveled down the white rapids of the toilet bowl into the sewer. My girlfriend nearly had a heart attack and then we were worried that a night time trip to the bathroom would result in the crunch of a roach body underfoot from guest yet unseen. I know this is the south and these little guys are locals, but I would be remiss if I didnâ€™t mention the gross out encounter. Other than that this was a nice stay!

It is a little close to a busy intersection, but I personally did not find that bothersome or the traffic noise disruptive. It felt safe. The host is on top of everything and very knowledgeable about the city as a whole. Would definitely stay here again.
